perturbation.original_text: The Company agrees that it shall hold the 2020 Annual Meeting no later than July 8, 2020 and shall not cause or permit any delay, postponement or adjournment thereof, except for any adjournment solely due to a lack of quorum under the Company's Fourth Amended and Restated By-Laws (the "By-Laws").
perturbation.changed_text: The Company agrees that it shall hold the 2020 Annual Meeting no later than December 31, 2020 and shall not cause or permit any delay, postponement or adjournment thereof, except for any adjournment solely due to a lack of quorum under the Company's Fourth Amended and Restated By-Laws (the "By-Laws").
perturbation.explanation: Delaying the annual meeting until December 31, 2020, could violate Delaware law if it is outside the permitted window for holding annual meetings, especially given the company's bylaws and the specific context of director elections agreed upon in the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware General Corporation Law (DGCL) ยง211 regarding timing of annual meetings

perturbation.original_text: The Parties acknowledge that to the extent they have not already done so, within three (3) business days of the date hereof, the Company shall enter into an indemnification agreement with each of the New Directors in the form attached as Exhibit 10.20 to the Company's Annual Report on Form 10-K, previously filed with the SEC on March 16, 2020.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties acknowledge that the Company will enter into an indemnification agreement with each of the New Directors at its sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the three-day deadline and making the indemnification agreement discretionary, the modified text introduces a contradiction. Indemnification agreements for directors are considered best practices for corporate governance and are expected to be provided promptly. A discretionary approach may violate fiduciary duties to the new directors, potentially conflicting with corporate law obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of fiduciary duties under Delaware corporate law, related to fair treatment and protection of directors.

perturbation.original_text: Within five (5) business days following receipt of reasonably satisfactory documentation thereof, the Company will reimburse the MG Capital Parties for their fees and expenses (including all legal, public relations, proxy advisory and out-of-pocket expenses, the "Expenses") incurred in preparation for and in connection with the matters relating to the consent solicitation run by the MG Capital Parties, the 2020 Annual Meeting and the negotiation, execution and effectuation of this Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby, in an amount equal to $352,290.25 (the "Initial Reimbursement").
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will reimburse the MG Capital Parties for their fees and expenses at the Company's discretion, with no guaranteed timeline or amount.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the definite timeline and guaranteed amount for reimbursement, the modified text introduces a legal contradiction. This contradicts the initial agreement to reimburse expenses, potentially leading to breach of contract claims. It also creates uncertainty regarding financial obligations, affecting the enforceability of the agreement and potentially violating principles of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract principles, good faith and fair dealing obligations under contract law.
